page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: The two villages of Hothfield & Westwell are divided by the A20;the minor roads forming a web whose strands either lead to & from the A20 or parallel to it.Both villages lie on the north eastern edge of the Weald of Kent just under the North Downs which are part of a range of chalk hills. Westwell is tucked very close to their steep scarp slope at the eastern end of the block. Hothfield is at the western end & lies mainly on a bed of Lower Greensands known as Folkestone Beds & Sandgate Beds which form the profile of Hothfield Common with its peat bog. The basic orientation of the valleys within the block is roughly east to west with springs & streams leading to the River Stour just off the western end of the block.
